moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Bd6: now his bishop has no important space to control, and the Queen's pawn is also disabled
moves.3. d4 Nc6: i think better would be 3. ... e5:d4 4. Q:d4 and then Nc6 or if 4. N:d4 Be5

moves.4... Nce7 5. Bc4 h6: i have no any good idea about what was this move made for, i think it's a wrong option
moves.6... Bb4: he used his bishop to send my Knight off, well, know i can also use my black bishop
moves.8... d6: no surprise really he just defends his pawn and opens the way for his white bishop
moves.10. h3 Bxf3 11. Qxf3 h5: maybe he wants to develop his rook, this pawn will be just a free victim for me if blacks ... 0-0, so i decided not to let his rook to come out
moves.12. Bd2 h4 13. Qg4: now i see nothing dangerous after this move, so i'm trying to attack his "g7" pawn
moves.14. f4: i want my rook to join the battle, i have a huge advantage, his queen and left hand side knights are undeveloped.
moves.17... Rg6: oH! "h4" pawn is now can be got for free
moves.18. Qh7 dxe5: but, here he does change my plans, he left a huge space for me to attack from the left side
